page.title: 07FARMING AROUND CLYRO.
page.content: The farms around Clyro are of two distinct types. The hill farms bordering the Wye Valley are small family run farms depending mainly on sheep. The farms of the broad valley floor are larger farm estates with a mixture of arable and livestock. Typical of the small family farms is the farm at {Tirmynach.}The farm is worked by a single family. Mr. Awford farms the land with the help of his wife and his sons, who are still of school age. {Tirmynach,}is 97 acres in total. Thirteen acre are generally used for the growing of corn, mainly barley. The rest of the land is used for {grazing, silage or hay.}The land is grazed by{200 ewes and their lambs, {nine rams, a horse and 32 young {cattle.}One sheep dog helps with the rounding up of the sheep.
